samples.context: The conduction of stimuli by the nerve cells is called nerve impulse. The dendrites will receive the stimuli from the receptor and conduct the same as electrical impulse to the axon through the cyton.
samples.question: What is the definition of nerve impulse?

samples.context: At the synapse, the synaptic knobs release out chemical substances called neurotransmitters which convert the electrical impulse into chemical impulse and pass it to the neighbouring cells.
samples.question: What role do neurotransmitters play in nerve impulses?

samples.context: The dendrites will receive the stimuli from the receptor (sense organ) and conduct the same as electrical impulse to the axon through the cyton.
samples.question: What do dendrites receive from the sense organs?

samples.context: The conduction of stimuli by the nerve cells is called nerve impulse. The dendrites will receive the stimuli from the receptor and conduct the same as electrical impulse to the axon through the cyton.
samples.question: How is information transmitted in nerve cells?

samples.context: The synaptic knobs release out chemical substances called neurotransmitters which convert the electrical impulse into chemical impulse and pass it to the neighbouring cells.
samples.question: What happens at the synapse during nerve impulse transmission?
